「Divination for Determining Whether One Should Depart or Remain in a Residence (Method 58)
Observe the day’s **hour (辰)** and its **auspicious deity (上神) and general (将)**. If the **auspicious deity (王)** and **resting qi (休气)** above and below are in mutual **defeat (克)**, then departure is auspicious. If the **auspicious deity (吉神) and general (将)** of the **yin (阴)** hour are obtained, and the **auspicious deity (王)** and **resting qi (休气)** above and below are in mutual **harmony (生)**, then remaining is auspicious.

This is determined by the **yin (阴) and yang (阳) auspicious deities and generals (神将)** and their forms. For instance, if **Bái Hǔ (White Tiger, 白虎)** is in the **yang (阳)**, then departure is auspicious; if **death and mourning (死丧)** are not in the **yang**, then remaining is permissible. Apply this principle accordingly.

**Divination for Determining the Fate of News About a Person of Rank (Method 59)**
Observe the **yin (阴) and yang (阳)** of the day’s **hour (辰)** and whether the reported matter aligns with it. If it aligns, then it is true; if not, then it is false. For example, if one hears that someone is a **thief (盗)**, and today’s **hour (甲)** is the **hour of the thief**. If **Shèngxiān (胜先)** is **Xuánwǔ (玄武, Black Tortoise)**, present in the **yin (阴) and yang (阳)** of the day’s **hour**, then it aligns. If **Shèngxiān (胜先)** is at **wǔ (noon, 午)**, then **wǔ** is the aligning hour. If **Tàiyī (太一)** is **Xuánwǔ (玄武, Black Tortoise)** without the **hour of the thief (甲)**, then **wèi (巳)** is non-aligning.

It is said: If one hears of a **death (死)** under discussion, and the **auspicious deity (神)** borne by the **White Tiger (白虎)** aligns with today’s hour, then death will occur. If it aligns with today’s **hour (辰)**, death will also occur. For instance, if today’s **hour (子)** is **zǐ (子)**, and **zǐ** aligns with **chǒu (丑)**, then **White Tiger (白虎)** is present—this is true. Otherwise, all such news is false.

The same principle applies to **divination for descendants (子孙)** regarding **auspicious (吉)** or **inauspicious (凶)** matters. If one hears of an **auspicious matter (吉事)**, observe whether **Qīnglóng (青龙, Azure Dragon)** and **Liùhé (六合, Six Harmonies)** are present in the day’s **hour (辰)**—this is true. Otherwise, it is false.

If one hears of an **inauspicious matter (凶事)**, observe the **White Tiger (白虎)** in the **hour (辰)** and the **auspicious deity (上神)** of the day’s divination. If **Qīnglóng (青龙)** and **Liùhé (六合)** align with today’s hour, then the reported matter is not auspicious—this is true.

However, these examples cannot be fully enumerated; they depend on the **pivot of the deities (神枢)**.

□ (Divination for) the **Truth or Falsehood of Reported Matters (所闻虚实篇)**.

**Divination for Determining Whether a Person’s Undertaking Will Succeed (Method 60)**
Observe the category of the matter in the **yin (阴) and yang (阳)** of the day’s **hour (辰)**. If it harmonizes with the **auspicious deity (上神)** of the day, then it is auspicious. If the matter’s category is not present in the **yin (阴) and yang (阳)** of the day’s **hour**, and it further conflicts with the **auspicious deity (上神)**, then the undertaking will not succeed. For instance, if one wishes to construct a residence, and the **auspicious deities (大吉)** and **Shèngxiān (胜先)** are present in the **yin (阴) and yang (阳)**, harmonizing with the **auspicious deity (上神)** of the day, then it is auspicious and will succeed. Otherwise, it will not succeed.

**Divination for Determining Whether a Person’s Worries Will Be Resolved (Method 61)**
At the time of inquiry, observe the **hour (辰)** of the day and the **auspicious deity (上神)** of the person’s **year (年)**. If there is a **resting qi (王相气)** or **directly useful deity (直用神)**, and the **transmission (传)** obtains its **child (子)**, then the worries will be resolved.

If the **useful deity (用神)** is the **resting qi (王相气)**, and the **transmission (传)** obtains its **child (子)**, but the **child** lacks **qi (气)**, then even if resolved, it remains difficult. Without **qi (气)**, it cannot overcome the presence of **qi (气)**; if the **useful deity (用神)** is **imprisoned (囚)** or **killed (死)**, and the **transmission (传)** obtains its **child (子)**, then the **child** is **imprisoned (囚)** or **killed (死)**. If both have **qi (气)**, it is resolvable; if the **child (子)** is **resting qi (王相)**, then the worries are doubly resolved.

For example, if in the **10th month (十月)**, on a **dīnghài (丁亥)** hour with **wèi (未)** added, one divines worries with uncertainty. If **Shèngxiān (胜先)** is at **hài (亥)**, with the **defeating (贼)** below and **auspicious deity (上)** above, it is **defeated (克)** by **resting qi (王相)**. If the **transmission (传)** obtains **Dàjí (大吉)**, then it obtains the **child (子)** of the **defeated (贼)**, and the **child** is the **imprisoned (囚)** or **killed (死)** **qi (气)** of the worries, indicating a **resolution (解)** of the worries, though it remains difficult.

For instance, in the **4th month (四月)**, on a **bīngyín (丙寅)** day at the **chǒu (丑)** hour, if **Shénhòu (神后, Deity of the Later Heaven)** is at **bīng (丙)**, with the **auspicious deity (上)** defeating the **defeating (下)**, then the **defeating (贼)** is the **useful (用)** one. **Fire (火)** holds **worries (忧)**, and if the **transmission (传)** obtains **Xiǎojí (小吉)**, the **child (子)** of **Fire (火)** in **Xiǎojí (小吉)** has **royal qi (王气)**, thus doubly resolving the worries.

To know the **period of resolution (解期)**, observe the **auspicious deity (用神)** that **generates (生)** the **auspicious period (吉期)** and that which **fears (畏)** the **inauspicious period (凶期)**.

The **auspicious period (吉期)** is determined by the **hour (地辰)** of the **auspicious deity (用神)**, and the **inauspicious period (凶期)** by that which it **fears (畏)**. For example, if **Shèngxiān (胜先)** is at **water (水)** as the **useful deity (用)**, then **wùjǐ (戊己)** are the **auspicious periods (吉期)**, and **rén guǐ (壬癸)** are the **inauspicious periods (凶期)**. If **Shèngxiān (胜先)** is at **metal (金)** as the **useful deity (用)**, then **rén guǐ (壬癸)** are the **auspicious periods (吉期)**, and **bǐngdīng (丙丁)** are the **inauspicious periods (凶期)**. Apply this principle accordingly.

**Ancient Method for Divining Whether Prior Matters Will Be Captured (Method 62)**」

chunks.original_text: 行时，欲今日日辰上神，与人年上神贼，所求物神，即日得。 若物类神，贼日辰上神，又害人年上神为凶，凶即不得也。 所谓物类者，虎豹，以功曹； 鹿兔，以太冲； 野兽、豕，以登明； 乌，以从魁； 马，以胜先。 占人始欲带制新衣吉凶法第六十三 正日时，欲令日辰上得吉神将、有王相气，又令青龙、太常在日辰阴阳中。 阴阳中所居神，与今日日辰相生者吉。 非此者凶。 纵青龙、太常不在日辰阴阳中； 宜视青龙、太常所居神，与今日日辰相生者，亦吉也。 占弟子始事师得成达否法第六十四 以今日之辰，占之。 日为弟子身，辰为所学者时下辰，为师，欲令其子加母时，必见受道成於师。 又顺天道，又欲令日辰上得吉将神，有王相者，休气上下相生，其用神终於吉神将，有王相气者吉。 无令辰上神上下相贼，其发用神又终於神上之墓，而无气者，忧学不达也。 假令正月丁卯日日出时，登明加卯，丁为弟子身，卯为所学者时下辰。 为师，丁日加卯者，子从母也。 卯上神上下相生，用终功曹，将得金神，不相刑，又有王相之气，此为学者达矣。 占内寄者吉凶法第六十五 内寄者，无令五行加其所忧，及今日之辰，阳神所临之地辰，贼今日日辰，皆为害主人。 假令九月甲寅日时加酉，内寄者，此为五行加其所忧，又今日日辰，阳神、功曹临申，申为金，贼今日甲寅木，此为临地辰，贼今日日辰也。 他效此。 又式经曰：凡有室宅，欲内他人者，慎无令时下辰之阳神临日辰皆今日日辰为害辰。 假令十月甲寅，功曹加申，此为时下之神害今日之辰也。 谓申上之神传送加寅之上下克日辰，日辰复在申上被克也。 时下者，诸日所加十二辰也。 辰之阳神者，今日时下支上神也。 谓不欲此支上神，令加其所临日辰伤今日辰也。 又各从豹尾来不可，诸物皆同。 假令十月丁巳日申时，以月将功曹加申，太一临亥。 太一巳之阳神，火也； 亥水也。 亥遇克丁巳为害主，为所临日辰害今日日辰也。 他准此。 其合，主一贼入家。 假令七月癸已日，太一加此合仿之神。 枢曰：若欲寄止於人家，神后临行年者，主人欲谋危客。 日辰上见天魁白虎者，主人欲谋杀客。 日辰上见登明天空者，主人欲谋诱客，并宜急去。 若日辰上见吉将、王相相生者，并吉，无他故也。 占怪祟恶梦法第六十六 正日时，视日辰人年上神将，有王相休气，上下相生者吉。 非此者凶。 魁、罡、胜蛇、白虎临日辰人年者凶。 其神将王相忧王事，死丧囚气主亡遗，病伏废忧六畜也。 其用神在阳为忧外事，在阴忧内事，各以其家人年上神言之。 假令年俱立，恶将下未，必俱恶。 以天罡所临，别加阳忧男，加阴忧女，加孟为长，加仲伤家母，加季忧小口。 式经云：神在外，比邻受殃； 在门，家人受殃； 在内，身受殃。 又曰：人年日辰上见戌，犬怪； 见酉，釜呜； 见申，兵刀不葬，鬼怪； 见木，墓鬼呼怪； 见午，马血怪； 见辰巳，龙蛇怪； 见寅，乌兽怪； 见丑，牛畜风尘怪； 见亥，子猪风怪也。 占知死人魂魄出否法第六十七 正日时，时下辰为死，加辰上神胜日上神胜日上神及时下辰者，为复杀。 式经云：以家长行年加子，若太岁人年命日辰上，见魁罡、小吉、剩蛇、白虎有鬼。

**Method 63: Divining the Auspiciousness of Wearing New Clothing at the Start of an Undertaking**

At the proper hour, seek that the **auspicious deity (吉神)** of the **hour (地辰)** harmonizes with the **deity of the wearer’s birth year (人年上神)** and the **deity of the object (物神)**—thus, the request will be fulfilled that very day.

If the **object’s category deity (物类神)** harms the **hour’s deity (日辰上神)** and also injures the **deity of the wearer’s birth year (人年上神)**, it is inauspicious, and the request will not be granted.

The **object’s category deities (物类)** are as follows:
- **Tigers and leopards (虎豹)** → **Gōngcāo (功曹)**
- **Deer and rabbits (鹿兔)** → **Tàichōng (太冲)**
- **Wild beasts and pigs (野兽、豕)** → **Dēngmíng (登明)**
- **Crows (乌)** → **Cóngkuí (从魁)**
- **Horses (马)** → **Shèngxiān (胜先)**

---

**Method 64: Divining Whether a Disciple’s Study Will Succeed Under a Teacher**

Observe the **hour (辰)** of the present day. Let the **day (日)** represent the **disciple’s body (弟子身)**, the **hour (辰)** represent the **time of study (所学者时)**, and the **hour’s deity (辰上神)** represent the **teacher (师)**. If the **child (子)** aspect of the hour’s deity **adds to the mother (母)**, the disciple will certainly receive the **Dao (道)** from the teacher.

This also aligns with the **Heavenly Way (天道)**. Seek that the **hour’s deity (日辰上神)** be an **auspicious general deity (吉将神)** with **royal presence (王相气)**, and that **Qīnglóng (青龙)** and **Tàicháng (太常)** reside within the **yin-yang polarity (阴阳)** of the hour. The deities residing in the **yin-yang polarity** that **harmonize (相生)** with the **hour’s deity (今日日辰)** are auspicious. If not, it is inauspicious.

Even if **Qīnglóng (青龙)** and **Tàicháng (太常)** do not reside within the **yin-yang polarity** of the hour, examine whether the deities they occupy **harmonize (相生)** with the **hour’s deity (今日日辰)**—this too is auspicious.

**Example:** On a **January *Dīngmǎo* (丁卯) day**, at **daybreak (日出时)**, **Dēngmíng (登明)** adds to **Mǎo (卯)**. **Dīng (丁)** represents the **disciple’s body (弟子身)**, and **Mǎo (卯)** represents the **time of study (所学者时)**—the **teacher (师)**. Since **Dīng (丁)** adds to **Mǎo (卯)**, it is the **child following the mother (子从母)**. The **hour’s deity (卯上神)** harmonizes above and below, and its **useful deity (用)** terminates at **Gōngcāo (功曹)**, encountering a **metal deity (金神)** without mutual assault (**不相刑**), and bearing **royal presence (王相之气)**—this indicates the scholar’s success.

---

**Method 65: Divining Auspiciousness for Lodging Internally**

For those lodging internally (**内寄**), ensure that the **Five Phases (五行)** do not **add to their worries (加其所忧)**, nor that the **yang deity (阳神)** of the **hour’s branch (今日之辰)** harm the **hour’s deity (今日日辰)**—all such cases harm the host.

**Example:** On a **September *Jiǎyín* (甲寅) day**, if **Yǒu (酉)** is added, this is the **Five Phases adding to their worries (五行加其所忧)**. Additionally, the **yang deity (阳神), Gōngcāo (功曹)**, occupies **Shēn (申)**—**Shēn (申)** is **metal (金)**, which harms today’s **Jiǎyín (甲寅) wood (木)**. This is the **hour’s branch deity (临地辰)** harming today’s **hour’s deity (今日日辰)**.

As the *Shìjīng (式经)* states:
*"For any dwelling, if one seeks to lodge another inside, be cautious that the **yang deity (阳神)** of the **hour’s branch (时下辰)** does not occupy the **hour’s deity (日辰)**—this is the **harmful hour (害辰)**."*

**Example:** On a **October *Jiǎyín* (甲寅) day**, if **Gōngcāo (功曹)** adds to **Shēn (申)**, this is the **hour’s branch deity (时下之神)** harming today’s **hour (今日之辰)**. This means the deity of **Shēn (申)** transmits and adds to the **Yín (寅)** above and below, assaulting the **hour’s deity (日辰)**, which in turn is assaulted by the deity of **Shēn (申)**.

The **hour’s branch (时下)** refers to the **twelve branches (十二辰)** added to each day. The **yang deity of the branch (辰之阳神)** is the **deity occupying the current hour’s branch (今日时下支上神)**. This means one must not allow this **branch’s deity (此支上神)** to **add to the deity of the day it occupies (所临日辰)**, thereby harming today’s **hour (今日辰)**.

Moreover, lodging near the **Pàowěi (豹尾)** is also inadvisable—all objects follow this rule.

**Example:** On a **October *Dīngsì* (丁巳) day**, at **Shēn hour (申时)**, if the **monthly general (月将) Gōngcāo (功曹)** adds to **Shēn (申)**, and **Tàiyī (太一)** occupies **Hài (亥)**, then:
- **Tàiyī (太一)** is the **yang deity of Sì (巳)**, which is **fire (火)**.
- **Hài (亥)** is **water (水)**.
If **Hài (亥)** encounters **Dīngsì (丁巳)**, it harms the host—this is the **deity of the occupied hour (所临日辰)** harming today’s **hour’s deity (今日日辰)**.

If the **Five Phases harmonize (合)**, it indicates **one robber entering the home (主一贼入家)**.

**Example:** On a **July *Guǐwù* (癸巳) day**, if **Tàiyī (太一)** adds to the **harmonizing deity (此合仿之神)**.

The *Shìjīng (式经)* further states:
*"If one seeks to lodge in another’s home and the **deity of the year (行年)** is occupied by **Shénhòu (神后)**, the host intends to harm the guest. If **Tiānkuí (天魁)** and **Báihǔ (白虎)** appear on the **hour’s deity (日辰)**, the host intends to kill the guest. If **Dēngmíng (登明)** and **Tiānkōng (天空)** appear, the host intends to seduce the guest—all cases require immediate departure. If **auspicious general deities (吉将)** and **royal presence (王相)** harmonize above and below, it is auspicious without other cause."*

---

**Method 66: Divining Ominous Portents and Evil Dreams**

At the proper hour, observe the **hour’s deity (日辰上神)** and the **deity of the dreamer’s birth year (人年上神)**. If they are **general deities (将)** bearing **royal presence (王相)** and **auspicious qi (休气)**, harmonizing above and below, it is auspicious. Otherwise, it is inauspicious.

If **Kuí (魁)**, **Gāng (罡)**, **Shèngshé (胜蛇)**, or **Báihǔ (白虎)** occupy the **hour’s deity (日辰)** or the **deity of the dreamer’s birth year (人年)**, it is inauspicious. Such deities portend:
- **Royal affairs (忧王事)**,
- **Death, mourning, or imprisonment (死丧囚气)**,
- **Loss of property (主亡遗)**,
- **Illness, hidden dangers, or livestock misfortune (病伏废忧六畜)**.

If the **useful deity (用神)** is in **yang**, it portends **external affairs (忧外事)**; if in **yin**, it portends **internal affairs (忧内事)**—each case is determined by the **deities of the household members’ birth years (各以其家人年上神言之)**.

**Example:** If both the **year (年)** and the **day (日)** are **evil (立)**, and the **evil general deity (恶将)** is below **Wèi (未)**, both will be evil. The **Tiāngāng (天罡)**’s occupation determines:

Another method: Add the **month’s branch (月将)** to the **month’s stem (月建)**.
If **Rén (壬)** or **Guǐ (癸)** from the **celestial canopy (天上)** add to the **hour’s branch (地辰)**, it is a **clear day (晴)**.

chunks.original_text: 日胜时上神，所言不实也。 辰上神亦如所言。 时与日辰相生，欲来和合也。 又云：辰上神与日上神相生者，亦欲如其言也。 太阴、天罡临日辰及将军年上，其言不信。 传送为朱雀，天空加日辰者，其言反覆，口舌来，为奸诈，不自奸所，左右边即奸诈人也。 又占，欲逃亡、战斗，当避太一，向之败也。 太一正月在子，二月丑，三月寅，四月卯，审贼来否。 若太一、神后加今日干，天罡、小吉前，若刑杀凶神俱加今日干为贼今日至。 支干上不见此神，为不来也。 望见道上人疑是贼否，支伤径可前，干伤径不可前。 又道上望见人，以月将加时，视日上辰加功曹，传送登明见吏。 若神后、太一，奸人盗贼； 魁、罡，主丧。 若病人，以月将加时，视日上辰加功曹，传送、登明见吏。 若神后、太一，奸人盗贼； 魁、罡，主丧。 若病人，从魁、胜先。 太冲、小吉白衣人。 神后临卯，为冤家也。 次客，一用起神后，二从魁，三功曹，四登明，五天罡，六大吉，七胜先，八太冲，九传送，十太一，十一天魁，十二小吉，阳取后三，阴取前五。 黄帝龙首经卷下竟
chunks.translated_text:
If the **day’s qi (日)** overcomes the **hour’s qi (时)** and the **celestial deity (神)** is ascendant, their words are false.
If the **hour’s star (辰)** is ascendant and the **celestial deity (神)** aligns as spoken, the words are true.
When the **hour’s qi (时)** and the **day’s qi (日)** and the **hour’s star (辰)** all harmonize, it signifies a coming accord.
It is also said: If the **hour’s star (辰)** and the **celestial deity (神)** harmonize with the **day’s qi (日)**, it likewise indicates that their words will be true.

If **Tàiyīn (太阴, Dark Moon)** or **Tiāngāng (天罡, Celestial Ganger)** aligns with the **day’s qi (日)** or the **hour’s star (辰)**, or if the **general’s year (将军年)** is ascendant, their words are untrustworthy.
**Chuánsòng (传送)** is the **Vermilion Bird (朱雀)**; if **Tiānkōng (天空, Celestial Void)** aligns with the **day’s qi (日)** or the **hour’s star (辰)**, their words will be contradictory, and **litigious disputes (口舌)** will arise—this indicates deceit, though not necessarily from themselves. The **left and right attendants (左右边)** will be the deceitful ones.

Again, if one seeks to flee or engage in battle, they must avoid **Tàiyī (太一, Supreme One)**—its alignment portends defeat.
**Tàiyī (太一)** is in **Zǐ (子)** in January, **Chǒu (丑)** in February, **Yín (寅)** in March, and **Mǎo (卯)** in April. This is used to verify if bandits will come.
If **Tàiyī (太一)**, **Shénhòu (神后, Celestial Deity’s Follower)**, and **jiānrén (奸人, deceitful ones)** or **dàozéi (盗贼, thieves/bandits)** all align with the **day’s stem (今日干)**, and **Tiāngāng (天罡)** and **Xiǎojí (小吉, Minor Auspice)** are before it, then bandits will arrive today.
If no such **celestial deity (神)** appears in the **branches (支)** or **stems (干)**, they will not come.
When observing a suspicious figure on the road, if the **branches (支)** harm the **path (径)**, one may proceed, but if the **stems (干)** harm the **path (径)**, one must not proceed.

Again, when observing a suspicious figure on the road, check if the **month’s star (月将)** aligns with the **hour (时)** and if the **day’s qi (日)** harmonizes with **Gōngcāo (功曹, Official Star)** while **Chuánsòng (传送)** and **Dēngmíng (登明)** appear with **officials (吏)**.
If **Shénhòu (神后)** or **Tàiyī (太一)** aligns, it indicates deceitful ones or thieves;
If **Kuí (魁)** or **Gāng (罡)** aligns, it foretells misfortune or death.
For the sick, if the **month’s star (月将)** aligns with the **hour (时)** and the **day’s qi (日)** harmonizes with **Gōngcāo (功曹)**, while **Chuánsòng (传送)**, **Dēngmíng (登明)**, and **officials (吏)** appear, then:
If **Shénhòu (神后)** or **Tàiyī (太一)** aligns, it signals deceitful ones or thieves;
If **Kuí (魁)** or **Gāng (罡)** aligns, it foretells misfortune or death.
If the sick person is seen under **Cóngkuí (从魁)** or **Shèngxiān (胜先)**, or if **Tàichōng (太冲, Supreme Surge)** and **Xiǎojí (小吉)** appear as a **white-clad person (白衣人)**, then:
If **Shénhòu (神后)** aligns with **Mǎo (卯)**, it marks a **grudge enemy (冤家)**.

**Method of the Guest (次客)**:
1. **Shénhòu (神后)**,
2. **Cóngkuí (从魁)**,
3. **Gōngcāo (功曹)**,
4. **Dēngmíng (登明)**,
5. **Tiāngāng (天罡)**,
6. **Dàijí (大吉, Major Auspice)**,
7. **Shèngxiān (胜先)**,
8. **Tàichōng (太冲)**,
9. **Chuánsòng (传送)**,
10. **Tàiyī (太一)**,
11. **Tàiyī (太一)** again (or **Tàiyīn (太阴)**),
12. **Xiǎojí (小吉)**.

Take the **last three** for yang and the **first five** for yin.

The **Yellow Emperor’s *Lóngshǒu Jīng* (黄帝龙首经)**—Chapter Two ends here.
